question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Q.title: Will Joe Biden announce his intention to run for re-election before July 15, 2024?
Q.body: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he intends to run for re-election as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle?

P_given_Q.title: Given Joe Biden announces his intention to run for re-election before July 15, 2024, will he also announce that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
P_given_Q.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he intends to run for re-election as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle? If this is true, then will he also announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the first part: Joe Biden must announce before July 15, 2024 that he intends to run for re-election as President. 

Resolution criteria for the second part: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce his intention to run for re-election before July 15, 2024, will he announce that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden will not announce before July 15, 2024 that he intends to run for re-election as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Q.title: Will Joe Biden announce his intention to run for re-election before April 1, 2024?
Q.body: Will Joe Biden announce before April 1, 2024, his intention to run for re-election as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle?

P_given_Q.title: Given Joe Biden's announcement intentions, will he announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden will announce his intention to run for re-election before April 1, 2024, as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce his intention to run for re-election before April 1, 2024, will he announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden will not announce before April 1, 2024, his intention to run for re-election as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. 

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. 

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

Q.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will other candidates' odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
Q.body: In the event that Joe Biden makes a definitive announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, will the Electoral College probabilities of other prominent Democratic candidates, as evaluated by Nate Silver's model, be greater than their current probabilities on August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if any candidate's probability exceeds their current standing, and NO otherwise.

P_given_Q.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

In this event, will the Electoral College probabilities of other prominent Democratic candidates, as evaluated by Nate Silver's model, be greater than their current probabilities on August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if any candidate's probability exceeds their current standing, and NO otherwise.

Additionally, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_not_Q.body:
In the event that Joe Biden makes a definitive announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, will the Electoral College probabilities of other prominent Democratic candidates, as evaluated by Nate Silver's model, not be greater than their current probabilities on August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if no candidate's probability exceeds their current standing, and NO otherwise. 

Suppose the following is also true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election. Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

Q.title: Will another prominent Democratic candidate enter the race if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the nomination?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a well-known Democratic candidate publicly announces their entry into the presidential race after Joe Biden's announcement and before the Democratic National Convention in 2024. It will resolve as No if no such announcement is made by that time.

P_given_Q.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election. Given this, will a well-known Democratic candidate publicly announce their entry into the presidential race after Biden's announcement and before the Democratic National Convention in 2024? Resolves YES if a well-known Democratic candidate announces their entry, and NO if no such announcement is made by that time.

Additionally, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

This question will resolve as Yes if no well-known Democratic candidate publicly announces their entry into the presidential race after Joe Biden's announcement and before the Democratic National Convention in 2024. It will resolve as No if such an announcement is made by that time.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

Q.title: Will a significant Democratic candidate enter the race for President after Biden's announcement?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a major candidate who is not currently in the race announces their candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President after Joe Biden announces he will not seek the nomination, before the Democratic National Convention in 2024. If no such candidate enters the race by that time, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given a significant Democratic candidate enters the race, will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: A significant Democratic candidate enters the race for President after Joe Biden's announcement that he will not seek the nomination. 

(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no significant Democratic candidate enters the race after Biden's announcement, will both Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination before July 15, 2024, and will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question considers two conditions: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No. (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. 

Resolution criteria: This question resolves as YES if both (a) and (b) are true, and resolves as NO if either (a) or (b) is false.

Q.title: Will another major candidate enter the Democratic primary race before July 15, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a significant political figure officially announces their candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024. A significant political figure is defined as someone with substantial political experience or a notable public profile. If no such announcement is made by that time, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that another major candidate enters the Democratic primary race before July 15, 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: A significant political figure officially announces their candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024. 

Then, will both of the following occur: 
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.
(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no major candidate enters the Democratic primary race before July 15, 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: No major candidate enters the Democratic primary race before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, meaning no significant political figure officially announces their candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States by that time. This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true:

(a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.
